form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Lee introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To enable passenger vessels that were not built in the United States to receive coastwise endorsement, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Jobs in American Ports Act.

subsection.text: Section 12112(a)(2)(B) of title 46, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (iii), by striking ; and and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: is a vessel that transports passengers between ports or places in the United States to which the coastwise laws apply, either directly or via a foreign port; and

subsection.text: Section 12121 of title 46, United States Code, is repealed.

Nothing in the amendments made by this section shall be construed to exempt a vessel that transports passengers between ports or places in the United States to which the coastwise laws apply, either directly or via a foreign port, from any applicable law of the United States except as explicitly provided in such amendments.
